Boston Harbor Islands

Meet onboard the 10:30 ferry to Spectacle Island. The boat will cost $12 and leaves at 10:30 sharp, so get there early to find the ticket office and the wharf. We will arrive at Spectacle Island 10 minutes later, spend an hour there, then catch the 11:45 ferry to Georges Island. We will catch the 1:30 ferry back to Boston arriving 1:55. Facilities are limited on Georges, so bring water and pack a lunch.

Harbor Express and Harbor Islands Express vessels depart from the north side of Long Wharf, adjacent the Marriott hotel and the Christopher Columbus Park. From the New England Aquarium, walk throught the lobby of the Marriott hotel and out the other side where you will see the ticket booth on your right.

Georges Island
At the time of Euro-American colonization, Georges Island was comprised of two drumlins, rising out of the bay like other nearby islands. The island was used for agricultural for two hundred years until 1825 when the U.S. Government acquired the island for coastal defense.
Over the next twenty years the island was dramatically altered and one of the country's finest forts was built. Dedicated in 1847, Fort Warren's defensive design was virtually obsolete upon completion. However the fort served as a training ground, patrol point, and Civil War prison that gained a favorable reputation for the humane treatment of its Confederate prisoners. After one hundred years of military use the fort was decommissioned in 1947 and acquired by the Metropolitan District Commission for historic preservation and recreation in 1958.
To this day, within the fort's dark corridors, the legend lives on of "The Lady in Black," the ghost of a Confederate prisoner's wife who is said to have been sentenced to death for aiding in an escape and hanged in a black robe made from the Fort's mess hall drapes.

Spectacle Island
Spectacle Island (105 acres) features a marina, visitor center, cafe, two sandy beaches, and five miles of walking trails that lead to the crest of a 157 foot-high hill, offering panoramic views of the harbor and the city. Supervised swimming is offered daily.
